title: Task 1: Describe visual elements of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately describe one visual characteristic of Androgyne III.
Response accurately describes one visual characteristic of Androgyne III.
Response accurately describes two visual characteristics of Androgyne III.

title: Task 2: Explain how a specific work of art demonstrates continuity and/or change within an artistic tradition, style, or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific visual evidence to explain how one characteristic of Androgyne III references the classical Western tradition of depicting the human body.
Response uses specific visual evidence to explain how one characteristic of Androgyne III references the classical Western tradition of depicting the human body.

title: Task 3: Explain the meaning or significance of continuity and/or change between works of art (or a group of related works of art) within a related artistic tradition, style, or practice.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific evidence to explain why the artist chose to depart from the classical Western tradition of depicting the human body in this work.
Response does accurately use specific evidence to explain why the artist chose to depart from the classical Western tradition of depicting the human body in this work.
